metadata.title: CVE-2018-12397 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A WebExtension can request access to local files without the warning promptstating that the extension will "Access your data for all websites" beingdisplayed to the user. This allows extensions to run content scripts inlocal pages without permission warnings when a local file is opened. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.3 and Firefox < 63.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12397` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
